New Records: Denver Nuggets struggled with three-point shooting, converting only 7 out of 38 attempts (18.4 percent) in their season opener against the Oklahoma City Thunder.
Key Match Events: The Nuggets recorded a season-low 87 points and their bench contributed minimally with just one made three-pointer, coming from Russell Westbrook.
Pre-Game Insights: Nuggets head coach Michael Malone acknowledged shooting as a pre-season concern, especially after losing Kentavious Caldwell-Pope, a key three-point shooter.
Post-Match Reflections: Nikola Jokic made a brutally honest admission about the team's shooting struggles, stating, 'We are not a good shooting team, except Mike and Jamal.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Nuggets' bench performed poorly, with Westbrook contributing just one made three-pointer out of six attempts.
